cryptography

Class Cyptography

  • java.lang.Object
    • cryptography.Cyptography

  • public class Cyptography
extends java.lang.Object
    Class handles the cryptographic operations of the applications.

    • Method Detail

      • hashKey

        public static byte[] hashKey(java.lang.String password)
                      throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

        Hashes a given string password using SHA-512, returning the result in a byte array of size 64

        Parameters:
        password - the string password to be hashed
        Returns:
        the 64 size byte array containing the hashed password
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • genSeed

        public static long genSeed(byte[] hashedKey)

        Generates a long seed from a hashedKey.

        The method performs multiple bitwise ORs ad ANDs between the long array and the key array, with insertion of 'random' bytes, to create an apparent random seed.

        Parameters:
        hashedKey - a byte array containing the key, this will be used to construct the long seed.
        Returns:
        an apparent random seed, created from the key.

      • cipherEncrypt

        public static byte[] cipherEncrypt(byte[] key,
                                   byte[] plaintext)

        Encrypts a given plaintext using a specified encryption key.

        Parameters:
        key - the key to be used for the encryption
        plaintext - the plaintext to be encrypted
        Returns:
        the produced ciphertext

      • cipherDecrypt

        public static byte[] cipherDecrypt(byte[] key,
                                   byte[] ciphertext)

        Decrypts a given ciphertext using a specified encryption key

        Parameters:
        key - the key to be used for the encryption
        ciphertext - the ciphertext to be decrypted
        Returns:
        the produced plaintext
